pinyin: rong2 yu4 bo2 shi4 xue2 wei4

sentences.english: They can fight for their motherlands and it is wonderful to bring honor.
sentences.chinese: 他们可以为祖国而战，这是极大的荣誉。

sentences.english: Honor and profit lie not in one sack.
sentences.chinese: 代表荣耀，荣誉与利益自古难两全。

sentences.english: From the father comes honour; from the mother, comfort.
sentences.chinese: 荣誉由父赐，安慰由母与。

sentences.english: Never had such an honor been accorded to any other Russian composer.
sentences.chinese: 从来没有一个俄国作曲家得到过这样的荣誉。

sentences.english: STEVE EMBER: Georgia O’Keefe received many honors during her long life.
sentences.chinese: 格鲁吉亚奥基夫在她漫长生命中获得了许多荣誉。

sentences.english: They gave him more eclat than he really deserved.
sentences.chinese: 他并不真得值得他们给他那么多的荣誉。
你因为什么赢得过荣誉？

sentences.english: Berries scoop up disease-fighting honors like kids in sports collect trophies.
sentences.chinese: 浆果在抵抗疾病上的荣誉就像孩子收集的体育奖杯。

sentences.english: In terms of honor, l stand aloof and will no reconcilement .
sentences.chinese: 雷为了荣誉，我的立场不会变，我们不可能调和。

sentences.english: No4. Doubt and even get jealous of the achievements and honors others get.
sentences.chinese: 对别人取得的成绩和荣誉常常表示怀疑，甚至嫉妒。

sentences.english: Bill grudged Dick his prize even though he had won a better prize himself.
sentences.chinese: 比尔妒忌迪克获奖，尽管他自己获得了更高的荣誉。

sentences.english: Our military has brought justice to the enemy and honor to America. (Cheers, applause.)
sentences.chinese: 我军已经将敌人绳之以法，给美国带来了荣誉。

sentences.english: However, it would be a mistake to rest on our laurels .
sentences.chinese: 然而，这将是一个错误的休息满足于既得荣誉。

sentences.english: He shall have his medal and diploma in the above-mentioned event withdrawn," the IOC said.
sentences.chinese: 他在前述赛事中的金牌与荣誉证书应被收回。

sentences.english: I don't care about scoring titles and individual accolades any more.
sentences.chinese: 我不在乎得分王和个人的荣誉了。

sentences.english: The Dalai Lama accepts his honourary Canadian citizenship in Vancouver.
sentences.chinese: 达赖喇嘛接受这一荣誉的加拿大公民在温哥华。

definition: special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
accomplishment/success/achievement/CL:個|个[ge4]/to achieve (a result)/to create/to bring about
achievement/meritorious deed/contributions (for the good of society)
